results.title: Safety in ceramics
results.creator_credit: Moorabbin College of TAFE and K Starbuck
results.brief_description: Introduces basic safety precautions for a ceramic studio when using clay as a creative medium in the classroom. Addresses safety and health hazards inherent in clay dust, the kiln, glazes, electricity and tools.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Moorabbin College of TAFE and K Starbuck
results.description: Introduces basic safety precautions for a ceramic studio when using clay as a creative medium in the classroom. Addresses safety and health hazards inherent in clay dust, the kiln, glazes, electricity and tools.

results.title: Safety II
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
A large number of small children and babies are injured every year in and around the home. These 5 short episodes look at child safety in a practical way. Focuses on issues such as common, easily swallowed poisons, burns, fire-proof clothing, the dangers of electricity, devices which can be installed to prevent electrical accidents, the hazards to be found in the backyard, the safe placement of furniture and fittings in the home, pool safety and rescusitation skills in case of drowning.

results.title: Safety depends on you
results.brief_description: Covers all general hand tool safety precautions including carrying, handling, use and storage. Hazards of improper acts - then correct methods are demonstrated.

results.title: Safety demonstration on the band saw
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Associates, E P Research and Robert L Wilkens
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the operation of a band saw and the basic safety procedures to follow when using it. Explains the different cuts, and use of various holding devices.

results.title: Safe Skateboarding
results.creator_credit: American Educational Films, Robert Springer and Billy Emmerson
results.brief_description: Outlines safety procedures and regulations regarding skateboard use. Includes information on maintenance of the board, riding techniques and protective clothing. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
